com.teamdev.jxbrowser.spellcheck

Interface SpellChecker

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EngineService

    public interface SpellChecker
extends EngineService
    Represents an engine service that provides functionality for configuring spell checking.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Dictionary customDictionary()
      Returns the custom dictionary.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> dictionaryNames()
      Returns an immutable list of the dictionary names used for spell checking.
      void dictionaryNames(java.lang.String... dictionaryNames)
      Updates the dictionary names used for spell checking.
      void disable()
      Disables spell checking on the web pages loaded in the browser instances of the engine.
      void enable()
      Enables spell checking on the web pages loaded in the browser instances of the engine.
      boolean isEnabled()
      Indicates whether spell checking is enabled or not.

    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled()
        Indicates whether spell checking is enabled or not. By default, it is enabled.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the engine is closed and its spell check service isn't available anymore

      • enable

        void enable()
        Enables spell checking on the web pages loaded in the browser instances of the engine.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Disables spell checking on the web pages loaded in the browser instances of the engine.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the engine is closed and its spell check service isn't available anymore

      • dictionaryNames

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> dictionaryNames()
        Returns an immutable list of the dictionary names used for spell checking. The dictionaries are downloaded programmatically and stored in the directory where the Chromium binaries are located.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the engine is closed and its spell check service isn't available anymore

      • dictionaryNames

        void dictionaryNames(java.lang.String... dictionaryNames)
        Updates the dictionary names used for spell checking.

        Important: on macOS this method updates the dictionary names, but these dictionaries will not be downloaded and used for spell checking. On macOS the platform spell checker is used instead. This platform spell checker automatically detects the language of the text.

        Parameters:
        dictionaryNames - the list of strings that represent the dictionary names. For example, "en-us", "ru", etc.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when one or more elements of the dictionaryNames are empty or blank
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the engine is closed and its spell check service isn't available anymore

      • customDictionary

        Dictionary customDictionary()
        Returns the custom dictionary.
